alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Donley; Gray; Roberts (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 3:58AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Armstrong, eastern Carson, Gray, southeastern Roberts and Donley Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 358 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of White Deer to 5 miles northwest of Brice. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Clarendon, Miami, White Deer, Mclean, Groom, Lefors, Howardwick, Hedley, Lelia Lake, Lake Mcclellan, Goodnight, Lora, Kingsmill, Alanreed, Codman and Greenbelt Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
